PAD_FoundBooks.synopsis: Player comments that the disc they found looks weird and should be brought to Laezel. Plays again for each chapter found, with variations if you've already found the true text behind it.Follow up in the LaezelInParty2 dialog.
PAD_FoundBooks.how_to_trigger: Pick up each of the Orpheus Chapters with Laezel being PartOfTheTeam.

PlayerDecipherChapter.synopsis: Players try to uncover the hidden messages in the Orpheus Chapters. They will be able to automatically decipher them if they have received Chapter 2 from the Gith Boy or found the Gith Cipher in the Underdark.Once a chapter has been set as Read, the true story will be available as a book the next time they interact with the item.
PlayerDecipherChapter.how_to_trigger: Pick up or read any of the still locked Orpheus Chapters

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters.synopsis: The Player manages to see the hidden text about Prince orpheus behind it. After the dialog, the book is updated with the true text and becomes a normal book.If players have obtained Chapter 2 from the boy, they unlock the book automatically.
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters.how_to_trigger: Avatar or Orphaned Companion Laezel reads the orpheus chapters 1 and 3. Only happens when interacting with a chapter that is not yet properly Read.

PAD_FoundBooks_0.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundBooks_0.text: Still another githyanki disc. I'll see what Lae'zel has to say.

PAD_FoundBooks_1.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundBooks_1.text: Another one of those githyanki discs. I should talk to Lae'zel.

PAD_FoundBooks_2.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundBooks_2.text: Still another githyanki disc - about the prince Orpheus, maybe. Lae'zel could make sense of it.

PAD_FoundBooks_3.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundBooks_3.text: Such a strange disc. Are these githyanki markings? Lae'zel might know.

PAD_FoundBooks_4.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundBooks_4.text: This gith slate looks like the other. Another story about the githyanki prince?

PlayerDecipherChapter_15.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_15.text: *The disc is similar to one you found before - and similarly baffling.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_33.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_33.text: *The disc is formed from slate and engraved with githyanki writing.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_39.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_39.text: *It closely resembles the disc that Lae'zel deciphered.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_69.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_69.text: *You examine them closely, but can't make much sense of them.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_1.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_1.text: *The symbols are striking to look at, but you aren't sure what they mean.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_3.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_3.text: *The disc from Crèche Y'llek was distinctly similar to this one. If you can match the symbols, you might find a legible pattern.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_64.speaker: Player
PlayerDecipherChapter_64.text: Command the disc to reveal its secrets.

PlayerDecipherChapter_73.speaker: Player
PlayerDecipherChapter_73.text: Compare the disc to the one from the crèche.

PlayerDecipherChapter_37.speaker: Player
PlayerDecipherChapter_37.text: Use the cipher you found to decode the symbols.

PlayerDecipherChapter_9.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_9.text: *A pattern forms as you gaze at the disc, and from within that pattern, a story emerges.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_25.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_25.text: *It is another chapter in the tale of the githyanki prince called Orpheus.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_34.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_34.text: *'The Prince of the Comet, Part One.'*
PlayerDecipherChapter_34.context: NodeContext: reading from a book, matter of factly

PlayerDecipherChapter_59.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_59.text: *'So it was that we were free from ghaik shackles and turned our blades on each other. The heavens were shattered, and one great empire was divided in two.'*
PlayerDecipherChapter_59.context: NodeContext: reading from a book, matter of factly

PlayerDecipherChapter_38.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_38.text: *'Gith travelled to the Hells to broker help for her people, her cause. Vlaakith would have you believe Mother Gith proclaimed her our queen.'*
PlayerDecipherChapter_38.context: NodeContext: reading from a book, matter of factly

PlayerDecipherChapter_45.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_45.text: *'Lies! Gith made no such proclamation. Vlaakith seized the empire against the Mother's wishes.'*
PlayerDecipherChapter_45.context: NodeContext: reading from a book, matter of factly

PlayerDecipherChapter_68.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_68.text: *'But Gith had nurtured a son. Orpheus, Prince of the Comet, the True Heir! He knew Vlaakith's treachery.'*
PlayerDecipherChapter_68.context: NodeContext: reading from a book, matter of factly

PlayerDecipherChapter_53.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_53.text: *'Orpheus rallied Gith's honour guard and declared the throne for himself. The War of the Comet had begun.'*
PlayerDecipherChapter_53.context: NodeContext: reading from a book, matter of factly

PlayerDecipherChapter_21.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_21.text: *It's an intriguing tale - and a forbidden one, given how expertly it was encoded.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_29.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_29.text: *Lae'zel will surely want to know of this.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_18.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_18.text: *'The Prince of the Comet, Part Three.'*

PlayerDecipherChapter_35.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_35.text: *'The histories tell us that Commander Voss, Jhe'stil Kith'rak, pierced Prince Orpheus clean through with his sword of silver. That his flesh was torn and fed to the great red dragon Ephelomon.'*
PlayerDecipherChapter_35.context: NodeContext: Reading a story, matter of factly. zhe-STILL KITH-rack. eff-ELL-eh-mahn

PlayerDecipherChapter_54.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_54.text: *'Vlaakith's faithful roar out this tale. But beneath the roars, we hear whispers carrying truth and prophecy.'*
PlayerDecipherChapter_54.context: NodeContext: reading from a book, matter of factly

PlayerDecipherChapter_31.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_31.text:
*'The Prince of the Comet is not dead.
The Prince of the Comet will come again.
The Prince of the Comet will liberate us from Vlaakith's tyranny.'*

PlayerDecipherChapter_44.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_44.text: *'Praise be to Mother Gith, Queen of the One Sky! Praise be to your son Orpheus, the True Heir, Prince of the Comet!'*

PlayerDecipherChapter_20.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_20.text: *It's an intriguing tale - and a forbidden one, given how expertly it was encoded.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_7.speaker: Player
PlayerDecipherChapter_7.text: Seek a pattern in the writing.

PlayerDecipherChapter_22.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_22.text: *In your mind's eye, the symbols trade places with each other until a clear pattern forms. And from that pattern, a story emerges.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_0.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_0.text: *No matter how hard you try, you can't make any sense of the symbols.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_5.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_5.text: *You should take the disc to Lae'zel. She might know more about it.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_66.speaker: Player
PlayerDecipherChapter_66.text: Recall your language lessons, try to arrange the symbols in a coherent order.

PlayerDecipherChapter_26.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_26.text: *You recall a method your ancestors used to conceal information from its illithid slavers and apply it to the disc. From the symbols, a pattern forms - and from that pattern, a story emerges.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_70.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_70.text: *You don't recall any lessons in githyanki code-breaking.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_52.speaker: Player
PlayerDecipherChapter_52.text: Stash the disc in your pack.

PlayerDecipherChapter_60.speaker: Player
PlayerDecipherChapter_60.text: Stash the disc in your pack.

PlayerDecipherChapter_23.speaker: Player
PlayerDecipherChapter_23.text: Stash the disc in your pack.

PlayerDecipherChapter_42.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_42.text: *Using the cipher you found, you might be able to reveal the disc's meaning.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_55.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_55.text: *Without a cipher or primer to aid you, the disc's message could be near-impossible to discern.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_16.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_16.text: *This time, the symbols easily resolve into coherent words and sentences. The story of Orpheus further unfolds.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_75.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_75.text: *The chapter ends there. This disc might be of some interest to Lae'zel.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_67.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_67.text: *The disc is similar to one you found before.*

PlayerDecipherChapter_74.speaker: Narrator
PlayerDecipherChapter_74.text: *Circular symbols are etched on the disc.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_8.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_8.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Companion Laezel holds out the disk and examines it.

|Reuse from PLA_GithChokepoint_ReadingMap|

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_73.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_73.text: It resembles the slate from Crèche Y'llek. I see similar patterns among the glyphs.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_114.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_114.text: Ah - another chapter of the Orpheus tale.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_18.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_18.text: 'The Prince of the Comet, Part One.'
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_18.context: NodeContext: ghaik = gayk. Reading a story.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_111.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_111.text: 'So it was that we were free from ghaik shackles and turned our blades on each other. The heavens were shattered, and one great empire was divided in two.'
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_111.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel reading from a book, matter of factly

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_49.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_49.text: 'Gith travelled to the Hells to broker help for her people, her cause. Vlaakith would have you believe Mother Gith proclaimed her our queen.'
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_49.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel reading from a book, matter of factly

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_65.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_65.text: 'Lies! Gith made no such proclamation. Vlaakith seized the empire against the Mother's wishes.'
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_65.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel reading from a book, matter of factly

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_4.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_4.text: 'But Gith had nurtured a son. Orpheus, Prince of the Comet, the True Heir! He knew Vlaakith's treachery.'
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_4.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel reading from a book, matter of factly

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_7.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_7.text: 'Orpheus rallied Gith's honour guard and declared the throne for himself. The War of the Comet had begun.'
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_7.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel reading from a book, matter of factly

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_30.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_30.text: The slate holds the truth. The prince still comes for his throne.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_103.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_103.text: Truth or not, it matters no longer. Orpheus is fallen. Vlaakith reigns supreme.
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_103.context: NodeContext: Can be said whether Lae'zel is sided with Orpheus or Vlaakith, so take care not to be too emotional either way.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_108.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_108.text: Incredible tale. I wouldn't have believed it, if we hadn't seen the prince for ourselves.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_100.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_100.text: A profane tale. These lies must perish with the prince who told them.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_13.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_13.text: This - this is drivel, surely. Gith declared Vlaakith queen of the empire, and her own son defied her. Orpheus would have ceded control to the ghaik.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_104.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_104.text: And yet - what if it's true? Could the City of Death have risen from a single Great Lie?

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_27.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_27.text: Tsk'va. Mother Gith, I implore you - show us truth.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_89.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_89.text: All of it, drivel. Gith declared Vlaakith queen of the empire, and her own son defied her. Orpheus would have ceded control to the ghaik.
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_89.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel now commenting harshly on what she just read

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_87.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_87.text: 'The Prince of the Comet, Part Three.'
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_87.context: NodeContext: Reading a story. zhe-STILL KITH-rack. eff-ELL-eh-mahn

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_61.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_61.text: 'The histories tell us that Commander Voss, Jhe'stil Kith'rak, pierced Prince Orpheus clean through with his sword of silver. That his flesh was torn and fed to the great red dragon Ephelomon.'
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_61.context: NodeContext: Reading a story, matter of factly. zhe-STILL KITH-rack. eff-ELL-eh-mahn

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_46.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_46.text: 'Vlaakith's faithful roar out this tale. But beneath the roars, we hear whispers carrying truth and prophecy.'

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_58.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_58.text:
'The Prince of the Comet is not dead.
The Prince of the Comet will come again.
The Prince of the Comet will liberate us from Vlaakith's tyranny.'

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_37.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_37.text: 'Praise be to Mother Gith, Queen of the One Sky! Praise be to your son Orpheus, the True Heir, Prince of the Comet!'

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_79.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_79.text: The story is true - Orpheus is free. And right here, right now, we are writing its next chapter.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_83.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_83.text: We know how this story truly ends. With the death of the prince, and a throne left unchallenged.
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_83.context: NodeContext: Can be said whether Lae'zel is sided with Orpheus or Vlaakith, so take care not to be too emotional either way.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_63.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_63.text: Vlaakith has reigned unchallenged for millennia. Freeing Orpheus could be the first strike in a new war - as well as its last.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_77.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_77.text: Tsk'va. A failed prophecy. The Prince of the Comet will not live long enough to seize Vlaakith's throne.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_91.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_91.text: No, no. Gith's son died to Voss' blade. Orpheus is no more.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_0.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_0.text: This is more than a fable - it's an affront to the Undying Queen Vlaakith. Gith's son died to Voss' blade. Orpheus is no more.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_94.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_94.text: But every glyph is bent or mirrored, every symbol disordered. I can make no sense of it -

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_17.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_17.text: Ah, the cipher. I can use it to bring un-muddle this mess. Yes, I see shape, I see structure. I see - a story.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_55.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_55.text: Wait. The ga'varsh taught us how to decipher the ancient texts. Let me think.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_64.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_64.text: Ah, I see the pattern. The writings are - fables. No, beyond fables. Heresies.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_29.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_29.text: It shouldn't take much effort to decipher it. And... there. From madness rises meaning.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_10.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_10.text: *The tir'su engraved on the disc are ancient, but you recognise most of the symbols thanks to your rigorous studies on Crèche K'liir.*
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_10.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Avatar Laezel holds out the disk and examines it.

|Reuse from PLA_GithChokepoint_ReadingMap|NodeContext: Cresh keh-LEAR. TEAR-soo.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_36.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_36.text: *As with the boy's slate in the mountain crèche, there are hidden writings among the glyphs.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_92.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_92.text: *Your mind reassembles the symbols and a story takes shape.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_99.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_99.text: *'So it was that we were free from ghaik shackles and turned our blades on each other. The heavens were shattered, and one great empire was divided in two.'*
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_99.context: NodeContext: ghaik = gayk. Reading a story.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_22.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_22.text: *'Gith travelled to the Hells to broker help for her people, her cause. Vlaakith would have you believe Mother Gith proclaimed her our queen.'*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_14.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_14.text: *'Lies! Gith made no such proclamation. Vlaakith seized the empire against the Mother's wishes.'*
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_14.context: NodeContext: kith'raki = kith-RACK-ee. Reading a story.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_20.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_20.text: *'But Gith had nurtured a son. Orpheus, Prince of the Comet, the True Heir! He knew Vlaakith's treachery.'*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_3.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_3.text: *'Orpheus rallied Gith's honour guard and declared the throne for himself. The War of the Comet had begun.'*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_72.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_72.text: *Once, you might not have believed such a tale. But a new war is coming - and Orpheus will battle once more for the throne that belonged to his mother.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Avatar Laezel puts the disk away.|

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_78.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_78.text: *Whether the stories were true or fabrications, it matters no longer. Orpheus is fallen.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_98.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_98.text: *Orpheus - no longer just a story, but a reality. Gith's son lives.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_70.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_70.text: *It's a heretical tale. Your varsh taught that Orpheus defied the will of his mother Gith. He would have usurped the throne and weakened the empire.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_40.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_40.text: But maybe the teachings weren't real. Maybe Vlaakith betrayed Gith and seized control.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_5.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_5.text: *Your thoughts don't sit well with you. Could Vlaakith really have sacrificed Gith in exchange for the dragon alliance - and control of the empire?*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_67.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_67.text: *And if so, what else has Vlaakith lied to her people about?*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_51.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_51.text: These writings are pure propaganda, the work of an insidious apostate.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_50.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_50.text: *You've dedicated your life to your queen. Through her, your mind is silver, and your body steel.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_88.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_88.text: *Whoever speaks lies against Vlaakith must be decapitated and bisected, and their head brought to her court.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_31.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_31.text: *This is the way. This is your queen's command.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_44.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_44.text: It's just a story, as harmless as it is far-fetched.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_16.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_16.text: *Vlaakith gifted Gith to Tiamat in exchange for the red dragons? A ludicrous claim.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_80.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_80.text: *Vlaakith's rein is too secure to be shaken by old legends. Orpheus is long dead, and the queen is unfaltering.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_90.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_90.text: *You consider the tale. Vlaakith would call it profane. Only a heretic would think otherwise.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_35.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_35.text: *'The histories tell us that Commander Voss, Jhe'stil Kith'rak, pierced Prince Orpheus clean through with his sword of silver. That his flesh was torn and fed to the great red dragon Ephelomon.*'
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_35.context: NodeContext: Reading a story. zhe-STILL KITH-rack. eff-ELL-eh-mahn

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_48.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_48.text: *'Vlaakith's faithful roar out this tale. But beneath the roars, we hear whispers carrying truth and prophecy.'*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_19.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_19.text:
*'The Prince of the Comet is not dead.
The Prince of the Comet will come again.
The Prince of the Comet will liberate us from Vlaakith's tyranny.'*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_62.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_62.text: *'Praise be to Mother Gith, Queen of the One Sky! Praise be to your son Orpheus, the True Heir, Prince of the Comet!'*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_21.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_21.text: *This is no mere story. You have seen the truth unfold before your eyes. Orpheus will rise and guide the githyanki to freedom.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_2.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_2.text: *The story was mere wishful thinking, of course. Orpheus is defeated, and the prophecy's failed. The lich queen reins eternal.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_39.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_39.text: *A fantastical story. You would never have believed Orpheus lived, had you not seen him with your own eyes.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_43.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_43.text: *It's a heretical tale. Your varsh taught that Orpheus died at Voss' hands, and for good reason. He would have usurped the throne and weakened the empire.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_107.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_107.text: But maybe the teachings weren't real. Maybe Orpheus lives to this day.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_112.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_112.text: *Your thoughts don't sit well with you. Could Vlaakith really have lied about the death of Orpheus, Gith's only son?*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_75.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_75.text: These writings are pure propaganda, the work of an insidious apostate.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_86.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_86.text: It's just a story, as harmless as it is far-fetched.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_110.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_110.text: *Gith's son Orpheus still lives, and plans to depose Vlaakith? A ludicrous claim.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_97.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_97.text: *Their meaning, however, is garbled, as if they are codes needing to be deciphered.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_69.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_69.text: Use the cipher you found to reveal the true meaning.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_9.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_9.text: Think back on your lessons. Maybe you've learned how to unravel the cipher.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_41.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_41.text: *You remember a method of decoding cryptic tir'su. it appears to work even on these ancient texts.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_6.speaker: Lae'zel
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_6.text: Examine the tir'su closely, seeking greater understanding.

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_93.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_93.text: *A pattern emerges. You've cracked the code.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_82.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_82.text: *You can't make sense of the symbols, no matter how hard you try.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_52.speaker: Narrator
AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_52.text: *Like before, the glyphs require some effort to translate.*

AvatarLaezelReadsChapters_85.speaker: Lae'zel
